translated: Homage to that Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Rightly Self-awakened One
The Flower-garden of Methods🔽In the destruction of the family,
The eternal family virtues are destroyed;
When the Dhamma is destroyed, the whole family,
The unrighteousness overwhelms the wicked.
By the domination of unrighteousness, the tamed
Women of the family rebel;
When women are corrupted by their own Dhamma,
The mixture of castes is born.
Speak affectionately, take the best qualities,
Be a hero, be radiant;
The woman who is like the moon,

analyzed: diṭṭham diṭṭham naha āsaye  kutotthi ku mitte saccam
translated: Bathe as soon as you see her.🔽Where is truth in the assembly?
In the beautiful, the increase of pleasure;
In the beautiful country, the mind delights,

analyzed: ku rāje bhoga sampadam  saṅketa iva amittasmin
translated: In the Kurara country, the wealth of enjoyment.🔽As if in a sign, in the enemy,
In the friend, do not trust;
From fearlessness, fear arises,
It even cuts off the roots.
The other unseen is better,

analyzed: dummittaḥ no vissāsikaḥ  aggihoma phalam vedaḥ
translated: The ill-disposed one is not trustworthy.🔽The fruit of the fire sacrifice is the Veda,
The fruit of the sword is said to be virtue;
The fruit of the woman is Ratīputra,
The fruit of wealth is the enjoyment of giving.
Untruth, violence, and deceit,

analyzed: mūḍhatta mā tilobhatā  asocam niddayattam ca
translated: Not being greedy, not being deluded,🔽Not being sorrowful, not being spiteful,
Not being lazy, not being angry,🔽is natural.
The wife is a burden to the husband,
the pupil is a burden to the teacher,
the ministers are a burden to the king,
the children are a burden to the parents.
For it is by striving that things are accomplished,

original: Kammāni na manorathā;🔽Na hi suttassa sīhassa,
analyzed: kammāni na manorathā  na hi suttassa sīhassa
translated: not by wishful thinking.🔽For deer do not enter the mouth
of a sleeping lion.
Too cold, too hot,
too late this is what people say
when they are not doing the work they should be doing,

original: Khaṇā accenti māṇave.🔽Ādānassa padānassa,🔽Kattabbassa ca kammuno;
analyzed: khaṇāḥ accenti māṇave  ādānassa padānassa  kattabbassa ca kammunaḥ
translated: and the time passes for the young man.🔽For a deed that should be done🔽at the time of taking up the burden,
if it is not done quickly,

analyzed: kāle pivati sampadam  na adabbe nihitā kāci
translated: the opportunity is lost.🔽No deed is fruitful
if done at the wrong time.
Even though he is not skilled,

analyzed: pāṭhate bako  yaḥ dandha kāle tarati
translated: the crane cries out for luck.🔽He who crosses the river when it is shallow,
and crosses when it is deep,
like a dry leaf in the wind,
destroys his own welfare.
What he gives and what he enjoys,
that alone is the wealth of the rich.
Others play with his wife
and with his wealth when he is dead.
He who is without generosity and enjoyment,
The rich are happy with their wealth;
What is the difference with the poor,
Except for the extra worry of guarding their wealth?🔽One who is not able to enjoy his own wealth,
Who eats little and is a friend to all,
He who accumulates wealth,
Is a beast of burden for others.
Those who are not skilled in work,
But who desire much wealth,
Whether skilled or unskilled,
Fortune enjoys them all.
The mind of the great is soft,
Like a tender lotus in water;
But the mind of the great when fallen,
Is as hard as a rock.
Having endured what is impossible to endure,

original: Khedo mudhāva jāyate;🔽Avhāyaṃ canda mu llokya,
analyzed: khedaḥ mudhā ava jāyate  avha ayam canda mu llokya
translated: Exhaustion arises in vain;🔽Having seen the moon in the sky,

analyzed: na canda uta mu pa a gamī
translated: I did not come to see the moon.
One should keep truth on one’s face,
What is heard in the ears, one should keep in the arms;
In the heart, one should keep forgiveness and heroism,
And in the eyes, one should keep the world as a slave.
One should not be swayed by mere sound,
Without knowing the reason for the sound;
Having fully understood the cause of the sound,
One should be either delighted or afraid.
One should not be proud of all one has heard,
Whether low, high, or middling.
A family is pure if it has little wealth,
The child will be lost to the one who indulges it;
Samiddhi, a relative through misfortune,
is a shame to the one who lives apart from him.
Indulge him for five years,
and for ten years be indulgent;
When he reaches sixteen years,
treat him as a friend.
There are many faults in indulgence,
there are many virtues in indulgence.
He who restrains the wicked and unites them with the good,
who conceals their secrets and makes their virtues public,
who does not abandon them in misfortune and gives them timely aid,

original: Sammitta lakkhaṇamidaṃ pavadanti santo.🔽Dujjano jīyate yutyā,
analyzed: sammitta lakkhaṇam idam pavadanti santo  dujjanaḥ jīyate yutyā
translated: such a one is called a true friend by the wise.🔽The wicked are conquered by conciliation,
not by the wise man through harshness;
A great tree is felled
by the woodman through gradual approach.🔽Wild beasts and wicked men,
and those who are good but have no reason,
are enemies;
the grass-eaters are very gentle.
The elephant with his foot
and the thorn with his spike.
Do not look at a fool, do not listen to him,
do not associate with him;
Do not converse with a fool,
do not praise him or exalt him.
Just as a small bird
is not able to carry a great load,
A well slakes the one who is thirsty,

analyzed: natu pāyaḥ mahambudhi  ādānassa padānassa  kattabbassa ca kammunaḥ
translated: not the great ocean without a drink.🔽For the one who has taken up the practice,
and for the one who has the duty to do the work,🔽for the one who does not do it quickly,
time devours that taste.
The fool is overcome by gain,
while he is measuring the stars;
gain is the star of gain,
what will the stars do?
Wisdom is like the deathless,
think about the meaning of the knowledge;
as if seized by the hair,
practice the Dhamma with death.🔽The three are considered the kingdom:
the teacher, the elder, and the advisor;
the life of the people is skillful,
their increase and decrease.
Work increases with a leader,
not with a leader who is slow;
trees bear fruit in time,
even though there is much rain.
A man should strive,
a wise man would not be discouraged.
Such a one is not a striver,
by whom no fruit is obtained;
digging a well on a rock-peak,
how is there a meeting of water?
The elephant of exertion and striving,
is properly directed with the goad of knowledge.
One who does not consider his actions,
And quickly descend on you,

original: Tānikammāni tappenti,🔽Uṇhaṃ va jjhohitaṃ mukhe.🔽Chaddosā puriseneha,
analyzed: tānikammāni tappenti  uṇham va mukhe  chaddosā purisena iha
translated: The swift-falling results of actions🔽burn one, like hot ashes thrown into the mouth.
Six faults should be abandoned by one who desires prosperity:
sleep, intoxication, fear, anger,
laziness, and procrastination.

analyzed: na divā suppa sīlena  ratti muṭṭhāna dessinā  nicca soṇḍena mattena
translated: One cannot live at home with a mind constantly devoted to sleep,🔽intoxication, and laziness,
with a mind constantly devoted to sleep, intoxication, and laziness.
They fear what is not to be feared,
and do not fear what is to be feared.
Confused about fear and what is not to be feared,
they follow the crooked path, abandoning the straight path.
For one who, as a human being,
has neither wealth nor skill,
what is the fruit of being a human being?

analyzed: dvi pādaṭṭhaḥ hi saḥ migaḥ  nānā upāyaḥ uva kattabbaḥ
translated: For he is a two-legged animal.
If one has the means,🔽one should do what is beneficial by various means,
as one desires, for the accomplishment of one’s goals,

analyzed: upāyaḥ hi hitañjaso  lañja dāna bālisena  kūṭaḍḍakāra dhīvarā
translated: for the means are the source of benefit.🔽The foolish one who gives bribes,🔽the one who cheats with weights and measures,
the minister of justice who is greedy,
are swept away by the ocean of greed.
For one who has these four qualities,
just like the lord of the monkeys,
truth, righteousness, wisdom, and generosity,
He surpasses what is seen.

analyzed: vidvāca ratanam nārī  vīṇā sāttham giraṃmahī
translated: A woman is a jewel of speech,🔽A lute is a melodious voice, the earth;
Having attained special qualities,
The qualities and the non-qualities.
One who is wealthy and powerful in the world,
By wealth becomes wise.
A worm is dependent on a Sumana flower,
Without qualities, inferior by oneself;
To those adorning it with flowers,
The king's saliva also grows.
Accumulated by the unskillful,
Wealth and possessions are thought of;
At the end of the skillful one's existence,
The skillful one eats well with luck.
The warrior is the best among people,
He who follows the lineage;
Endowed with knowledge and conduct,
He is the best among gods and humans.
Even poison can be taken as nectar,
A supreme gem from excrement;
A flower from a thorny tree,
A beautiful woman from a bad family.
From the qualities of Dhanissara and others -
People are quickly carried away.
For whom there is always loving-kindness,
Beloved by the whole world;
Even a well appears as an ocean,
Fire appears as water for him.
Even Mount Meru appears as gravel,
The moon appears as poison for him;

analyzed: sasāyate migarāja  byālaḥ mālāguṇāyate  dolāyate chamācālo
translated: The deer king is full of hope,🔽The leopard is like a garland of flowers,🔽The chameleon is swinging,
The various weapons are like grass.
When there is the same amount of effort,
The good vehicle is beneficial,
But not so for the deficient or excessive,
The middle way is always good.
It is good to be wise,
But not to be overly wise.
